meanings.definition: The quality or state of being noisome; offensiveness or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The noisomeness of the garbage dump made everyone cover their noses.
meanings.sent2: The noisomeness of the spoiled food in the fridge was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The noisomeness of the skunk's spray lingered in the air, causing everyone to run away.
meanings.sent4: The noisomeness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over the otherwise cheerful party.
meanings.sent5: The noisomeness of the sewage leak was so intense that it could be smelled from miles away.

meanings.definition: A noisome or harmful quality or influence.
meanings.sent1: The noisomeness of the toxic fumes posed a serious threat to the workers' health.
meanings.sent2: The noisomeness of the gossip spreading around the office was causing tension among colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The noisomeness of the loud music blaring from the neighbor's house kept everyone awake at night.
meanings.sent4: The noisomeness of the negative comments was like a poison spreading through the online community.
meanings.sent5: The noisomeness of the dark clouds overhead signaled an impending storm.
